document_data.caption: Several jars.
document_data.name: Jar
document_data.mainbody: '''Jar''' was a general term for a style of cylindrical container in the Realms that came in a variety of sizes.
document_data.Availability: * ''[[Aurora's Whole Realms Catalogue (in-universe)|Aurora's Whole Realms Catalogue]]'' for 8 [[copper piece]]s to 3 [[gold piece]]s depending on the size.
document_data.Usages:
* Jars made of [[ceramic]] were used across [[Faer√ªn]] as receptacles to store common table [[wine]]. Notably, they were known for a satisfying uncorking sound that grew more pleasing the emptier the jar was. Large ceramic jars were used in wine-making in [[Muluk]], a city in [[Zakhara]].
* Though jars of all types were certainly common household items in the Realms, [[wizard]]s often used them to store specific ingredients or [[material component]]s.
* Through the use of special rituals and [[alchemical]] preservative fluids, [[necromancer]]s could use glass jars to preserve the mind of a creature into a form of [[undead]] known as a [[brain in a jar]].
* [[sealing wax|Wax]]-sealed jars could be used to store [[pickle]]d foods and preserves, such as [[honey]]ed [[fig]]s, whole [[lemon]]s,<ref>{{Cite web/Candlekeep forum/Questions for Ed Greenwood (2004)/Fruits in the Realms}} and [[egg]]s.
document_data.Varieties:
* [[Amphora]], a type of jar typically used to hold [[wine]].{{Cite web/Candlekeep forum/Questions for Ed Greenwood (2007)/Winemaking in the Realms}}
* [[Canopic jar]], a type of jar used to store preserved internal organs.{{Cite dragon/300/Shrouded in Death|78}}
document_data.Notable Users: * Jars were favored by wizards, who often had dozens within their laboratories.
